categories.name: AI-Assisted Development & Code Generation
categories.description: Tools that help write, optimize, or debug code for your web projects

tools.name: Claude
tools.description: A powerful AI assistant that can generate code, provide implementation guidance, and help debug issues
tools.evaluation: Excels at understanding complex programming concepts and producing functional code with proper explanations. Particularly strong with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Python.
tools.comparison: Compared to ChatGPT, Claude often provides more detailed explanations and cleaner code, but may be slightly slower for real-time interactions.
tools.tutorial: To use Claude for coding: (1) Clearly describe what you want to build; (2) Specify language and frameworks; (3) Ask for comments in the code; (4) Request step-by-step explanations.
tools.free_alternatives: ChatGPT (basic version), GitHub Copilot (limited version available for students)

tools.name: Cursor
tools.description: AI-powered code editor based on VS Code that helps write, edit, and understand code
tools.evaluation: Excellent for working with existing codebases. The integration with AI allows for seamless code generation and explanation within your development environment.
tools.comparison: Unlike ChatGPT and Claude which are chat-based, Cursor directly integrates AI into your coding workflow. Smoother than GitHub Copilot for larger code generations.
tools.tutorial: After installation: (1) Press Ctrl+K to activate AI features; (2) Highlight code and press Ctrl+L to get explanations; (3) Use comments to describe what you want to generate.
tools.free_alternatives: VS Code with GitHub Copilot extension (limited free tier)

tools.name: Windsurf
tools.description: AI coding agent that helps develop applications through natural language instructions
tools.evaluation: Particularly strong for beginners as it handles much of the technical complexity. Great for rapid prototyping and concept validation.
tools.comparison: More focused on application development than Cursor, with less emphasis on editing existing code. Better than ChatGPT for maintaining context across complex projects.
tools.tutorial: To build with Windsurf: (1) Describe your application in detail; (2) Let it generate the structure; (3) Review and refine through conversation; (4) Export the code when ready.
tools.free_alternatives: GitHub Codespaces with Copilot (limited free tier)

tools.name: GitHub Copilot
tools.description: AI pair programmer that integrates with your code editor to suggest code as you type
tools.evaluation: Excellent for boosting productivity with autocomplete-style suggestions. Works best when you have a clear direction for your code.
tools.comparison: More tightly integrated with coding workflow than Claude or ChatGPT, but less capable of creating entire applications from scratch compared to Windsurf.
tools.tutorial: After installation: (1) Start typing code or comments; (2) Copilot will suggest completions; (3) Accept suggestions with Tab; (4) Use // for more specific prompts.
tools.free_alternatives: Tabnine (limited free version)

categories.name: Web Deployment & Hosting
categories.description: Platforms for deploying and hosting your web applications

tools.name: Cloudflare Pages
tools.description: A JAMstack platform for frontend developers to deploy websites globally with continuous integration
tools.evaluation: Extremely fast global CDN with generous free tier (unlimited sites, 1M requests/day). Excellent for static and JAMstack sites.
tools.comparison: More generous free tier than Vercel or Netlify, but slightly fewer developer-focused features. Better performance globally compared to GitHub Pages.
tools.tutorial: To deploy: (1) Connect to GitHub repo; (2) Configure build settings; (3) Set environment variables if needed; (4) Deploy and connect custom domain.
tools.free_alternatives: GitHub Pages (more limited features)

tools.name: Vercel
tools.description: Platform for frontend frameworks and static sites that provides serverless functions and global CDN
tools.evaluation: One of the best platforms for Next.js deployments with excellent developer experience and preview deployments.
tools.comparison: Better integrated with Next.js than Cloudflare Pages, but potentially more expensive at scale. More advanced preview features than Netlify.
tools.tutorial: To deploy: (1) Connect to GitHub; (2) Import project; (3) Configure framework presets; (4) Deploy and set up domains.
tools.free_alternatives: Netlify (similar free tier), Cloudflare Pages

tools.name: GitHub Pages
tools.description: Hosting service that takes files straight from a GitHub repository
tools.evaluation: Simple and reliable for static content, directly integrated with GitHub repositories. Limited to front-end only.
tools.comparison: Much simpler than Vercel or Cloudflare Pages, but lacks features like serverless functions, build configurations, and advanced routing.
tools.tutorial: To set up: (1) Create repository with appropriate name; (2) Enable GitHub Pages in settings; (3) Choose branch to deploy; (4) Optionally configure custom domain.
tools.free_alternatives: GitLab Pages

categories.name: Domain Registration & Management
categories.description: Services for registering and managing domain names

tools.name: Spaceship.com
tools.description: Domain registrar mentioned in the training manual for purchasing domains
tools.evaluation: Offers simple domain management and supports direct Cloudflare integration. Accepts Alipay for convenient payment.
tools.comparison: Less known than Namecheap or GoDaddy, but often has competitive pricing, especially for first-year registrations.
tools.tutorial: To register: (1) Search for available domain; (2) Select and add to cart; (3) Complete checkout; (4) Configure nameservers if needed.
tools.free_alternatives: No free alternatives for domain registration, but Freenom offers some free TLDs with limitations

tools.name: Cloudflare
tools.description: Provides DNS management, CDN, and security services for domains
tools.evaluation: Excellent security features and performance optimization. Domains registered through Cloudflare are at wholesale prices with no markup.
tools.comparison: Better performance and security features than most domain registrars. More technical but more powerful than typical registrar DNS management.
tools.tutorial: To set up: (1) Create account; (2) Add site; (3) Update nameservers at registrar; (4) Configure DNS and security settings.
tools.free_alternatives: No completely free alternatives for domain management at this level

tools.name: Porkbun
tools.description: Domain registrar mentioned in the training manual
tools.evaluation: Known for competitive pricing, especially on newer TLDs. Simple interface and good customer support.
tools.comparison: Often cheaper than GoDaddy or Namecheap, especially for renewals. Less feature-rich than Cloudflare but simpler to use.
tools.tutorial: To register: (1) Search domain availability; (2) Add to cart; (3) Create account and checkout; (4) Configure DNS or export to other services.
tools.free_alternatives: No free alternatives for domain registration

tools.name: Namecheap
tools.description: Popular domain registrar mentioned in the training manual
tools.evaluation: Reliable service with good pricing and privacy protection included for many domains. Good support for developers.
tools.comparison: Generally better prices than GoDaddy, especially for renewals. More user-friendly than some technical registrars but not as developer-focused as Cloudflare.
tools.tutorial: To register: (1) Search for domain; (2) Add to cart; (3) Configure extras like WhoisGuard; (4) Checkout and manage DNS settings.
tools.free_alternatives: No free alternatives for domain registration

categories.name: SEO & Traffic Analysis
categories.description: Tools for optimizing websites for search engines and analyzing traffic

tools.name: Google Analytics
tools.description: Comprehensive web analytics service offered by Google
tools.evaluation: Industry standard for tracking website traffic with extensive features for analyzing user behavior, traffic sources, and conversions.
tools.comparison: More comprehensive than Cloudflare Analytics or Simple Analytics, but has a steeper learning curve. More privacy concerns than privacy-focused alternatives.
tools.tutorial: To set up: (1) Create Google Analytics account; (2) Add property for your website; (3) Get tracking code; (4) Add tracking code to your website header.
tools.free_alternatives: Cloudflare Web Analytics, Plausible.io (limited free tier)

tools.name: Google Search Console
tools.description: Tool for monitoring and optimizing a website's presence in Google Search results
tools.evaluation: Essential for understanding how Google views your site and identifying SEO issues. Provides valuable keyword and performance data.
tools.comparison: More focused on search performance than Google Analytics. No real alternative for Google-specific search data.
tools.tutorial: To set up: (1) Add property (URL or domain); (2) Verify ownership (via DNS, HTML file, or Google Analytics); (3) Submit sitemap; (4) Monitor performance and issues.
tools.free_alternatives: Bing Webmaster Tools (for Microsoft search engine data only)

tools.name: AITDK
tools.description: Extension that provides SEO metrics and insights directly in search results
tools.evaluation: Excellent for quick competitive analysis and identifying SEO opportunities without leaving search results pages.
tools.comparison: More convenient than traditional SEO tools for quick research, but less comprehensive than dedicated platforms like Ahrefs or SEMrush.
tools.tutorial: After installation: (1) Perform normal Google searches; (2) View SEO metrics directly in results; (3) Click on metrics for detailed analysis.
tools.free_alternatives: Detailed SEO Extension (more limited data)

tools.name: Ahrefs
tools.description: Comprehensive SEO toolset for backlink analysis, keyword research, and competitor analysis
tools.evaluation: One of the most powerful SEO tools available, with excellent backlink data and comprehensive site auditing capabilities.
tools.comparison: More comprehensive backlink data than SEMrush, but slightly more expensive. More technical than simpler tools like Ubersuggest.
tools.tutorial: To use: (1) Enter domain in Site Explorer for backlink analysis; (2) Use Keywords Explorer for keyword research; (3) Set up Site Audit to identify issues.
tools.free_alternatives: Ahrefs Webmaster Tools (limited), Ubersuggest (limited free tier)

categories.name: Game Development & Resources
categories.description: Tools and platforms for creating and integrating games into websites

tools.name: HTML5 Game Distribution
tools.description: Platform for finding and integrating HTML5 games into websites
tools.evaluation: Good source for ready-made HTML5 games that can be embedded into websites. Various revenue-sharing models available.
tools.comparison: More commercially focused than itch.io, with emphasis on distribution and monetization rather than independent game development.
tools.tutorial: To use: (1) Browse game catalog; (2) Select a game; (3) Get embedding code; (4) Add to your website with appropriate iframe settings.
tools.free_alternatives: itch.io (free HTML5 games section)

tools.name: CrazyGames
tools.description: Platform for HTML5 games with embed options for developers
tools.evaluation: Large selection of high-quality HTML5 games with easy integration through iframe embedding.
tools.comparison: Better game quality than many free HTML5 game sites. More user-friendly than some developer-focused platforms.
tools.tutorial: To embed games: (1) Find a game you want; (2) Look for embed option; (3) Copy iframe code; (4) Paste into your website.
tools.free_alternatives: GameDistribution.com (with ads)

tools.name: itch.io
tools.description: Marketplace for independent digital creators with many free and open-source games
tools.evaluation: Excellent for finding unique, creative games from independent developers. Many free HTML5 games available.
tools.comparison: More indie-focused than commercial platforms like CrazyGames or HTML5 Game Distribution. Better for unique games rather than mainstream titles.
tools.tutorial: To find HTML5 games: (1) Go to Games section; (2) Filter by HTML5 or Web; (3) Check licensing terms; (4) Either link to the game or embed if allowed.
tools.free_alternatives: No major alternatives with the same indie focus and variety

categories.name: AI Image Generation
categories.description: Tools for creating images using AI

tools.name: Midjourney
tools.description: AI image generation tool known for artistic and high-quality outputs
tools.evaluation: Produces remarkably creative and artistic images. Excellent for conceptual art, illustrations, and unique visual content.
tools.comparison: Better artistic quality than DALL-E 2 or Stable Diffusion in many cases, but requires Discord and has less direct control over outputs.
tools.tutorial: To use: (1) Join Discord server; (2) Go to a newbie channel; (3) Type /imagine followed by your prompt; (4) Choose variations or upscale results.
tools.free_alternatives: Stable Diffusion (self-hosted), Bing Image Creator (limited)

tools.name: DALL-E
tools.description: OpenAI's image generation model that creates images from text descriptions
tools.evaluation: Good balance between control and quality, with strong capabilities for realistic images and following detailed instructions.
tools.comparison: More precise control than Midjourney but sometimes less artistic. Better integration with OpenAI ecosystem than other tools.
tools.tutorial: Through API: (1) Get API key; (2) Set up API request with prompt; (3) Process and save returned image; (4) Implement in front-end with preview.
tools.free_alternatives: Bing Image Creator (powered by DALL-E but with limitations)

tools.name: Flux Shell
tools.description: AI image generation platform mentioned in training manual
tools.evaluation: Newer platform with innovative image generation capabilities. Good for technical and product illustrations.
tools.comparison: Less known than DALL-E or Midjourney, but potentially valuable for specific use cases like technical illustrations.
tools.tutorial: To use: (1) Create account; (2) Enter detailed prompt; (3) Adjust settings for style and detail; (4) Generate and download images.
tools.free_alternatives: Leonardo.ai (limited free tier)

tools.name: Ideogram
tools.description: AI image generation tool with strong capabilities for text rendering in images
tools.evaluation: Exceptional at generating images with text that is actually readable - a challenge for many other AI image generators.
tools.comparison: Better than Midjourney or DALL-E specifically for images containing text. Less artistic control than some specialized tools.
tools.tutorial: To use: (1) Sign up; (2) Craft prompt with clear text requirements; (3) Generate image; (4) Refine with feedback if needed.
tools.free_alternatives: Stable Diffusion with control nets (requires technical setup)

categories.name: Keyword Research & Market Analysis
categories.description: Tools for finding and analyzing keywords and market opportunities

tools.name: Google Trends
tools.description: Tool for examining search trends and comparing search term popularity over time
tools.evaluation: Excellent for identifying trending topics and seasonal patterns in search behavior. Provides relative popularity rather than absolute search volumes.
tools.comparison: Less detailed than paid keyword tools like Ahrefs or SEMrush, but better for trend analysis and completely free.
tools.tutorial: To use: (1) Enter search term(s); (2) Set region and time period; (3) Analyze trend graph; (4) Compare with related queries section.
tools.free_alternatives: Completely free tool

tools.name: Currentdomains.com
tools.description: Tool for checking domain availability based on current trends
tools.evaluation: Useful for finding available domains related to trending topics and keywords.
tools.comparison: More trend-focused than standard domain checkers like GoDaddy or Namecheap's search tools.
tools.tutorial: To use: (1) Browse trending domain categories; (2) Enter keywords or browse suggestions; (3) Check availability; (4) Register through linked registrars.
tools.free_alternatives: InstantDomainSearch.com

tools.name: InstantDomainSearch.com
tools.description: Fast domain name search tool for checking availability in real-time
tools.evaluation: Very fast domain availability checking with instant results as you type. Good suggestions for alternatives.
tools.comparison: Faster than traditional registrar search tools. More user-friendly than many alternatives but less feature-rich than some domain tools.
tools.tutorial: To use: (1) Type domain ideas to instantly see availability; (2) Browse suggestions; (3) Click on available domains; (4) Register through partner registrars.
tools.free_alternatives: Completely free tool
